website_summaries.verdict: We recommend the Canon Pixma MG5320 and its photo-friendly features for amateur photographers shopping for a do-most-of-it imaging device, but the step-up Pixma MG6120 is a better fit for multiuser offices.
pros: Canon's new imaging suite with HD Movie Print, automatic photo filters, Pixma Cloud Link printing, and an integrated disc labeler all make the Canon Pixma MG5320 more useful for amateur photographers
cons: The printer lacks an Ethernet port for wired networking, and with no high-yield cartridges available, consumables can get pricey

customer_reviews.title: Canon is in class action lawsuit over error U052 that causes printer to stop working!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and then came up with error U052 which disabled all of the printers functions... after doing some research, I discovered Canon is in the middle of a class action lawsuit involving 18 printer models (including the MG5320) that all eventually come up with this error and Canon knew about it... if it's out of warranty (1 year) then you're out of luck so don't buy this printer!!! I contacted Canon when the error came up and they told me I'd need a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: This printer arrived on Saturday and I used it a ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer arrived on Saturday and I used it a couple of times just to check it out. When I tried to use in Monday morning, I got a B200 message, telling me to turn off the printer and unplug it and contact the service department. I went to the Canon website to see what a B200 message meant and I followed the instructions that were given there but I still got a B200 message telling me to unplug the unit and contact the service department. Kind of an expensive printer, over $300 and all I got to do was to print out a test sheet to make sure it worked, and then it didn't work any more.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C. Corbin, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Constantly loses connection to wifi. Takes 5 minutes to warm up before printing (if it hasn't been used in a while). Runs out of ink over the course of a few weeks (even when it hasn't been used, so I guess it evaporates). Refuses to print a black and white text document when it is out of Magenta. Why would it need magenta to print black and white?!!?? Not very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: MechKeyLover

customer_reviews.title: printer
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent all in one printer. Many options. Nice that it is wireless. Doesn't have to be in same room and can easily accommodate more than one computer. Ability to duplex print saves paper. I have owned Canon printers in past and did not hesitate to purchase this one. Haven't printed photos yet, but since its same mechanics as my previous printer I can expect photographic quality. Nice addition for me is the scanner built into it. Don't have to drag out big scanner when needed. Easy installation, just run CD and its up and running. I recommend this highly..
customer_reviews.author: TADTAM

customer_reviews.title: so it isn't like I used it a lot
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. It didn't even last one year. I never did get around to printing any photos, so it isn't like I used it a lot. Once a Canon product is off warranty, they want to charge you for tech support, and there the only repair station in Denver is about 20 miles away. I replaced a print cartridge and got a message B200, which means there is something wrong inside the printer. I trusted this brand so I bought lots of print cartridges. The whole lot is going right into the trash. I will again hook up my old HP printer that I have had for years. I thought this Canon would be better. CARPE DIEM!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: DIED AFTER 7-8 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: it just died, no power. will not turn back on. killed itself. as suggested by Cannon, pull power cord and switch where it's plugged in at or plug it directly into a wall. will not power on. waited 10+ minutes with it disconnected from all power, still will not power on after being plugged back in. I don't smell any magic electronic smoke, nothing is burnt or singed. it was used via WiFi and sat on top of a entertainment center and was loved and cared for. what gives ?!?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only good for about a year.
customer_reviews.text: The print quality was fine. However, the wifi quit working after about a year. Now, it's saying there is a b200 error, apparently the printer heads are cooked. BOTH of these problems appear to be common to Canon printers. My HP printer lasted for over a decade without problem. I will go back to the brand I should have stayed with in the first place. I gave it 2 stars instead of one only because it was a good printer for about a year before the problems began.
customer_reviews.author: W. F. Shores

customer_reviews.title: Printer Works Great but Trashed It When Error After Changing Ink
customer_reviews.text: I used to love it until I had to change the ink. I used it at church to print labels on CDs and it did pretty well. Once I tried to change the ink with a non-OEM cartridge, it kept saying that the printer head was installed incorrectly. I trashed the non-OEM ink and bought genuine cartridges thinking it was just picky, but the same error showed up. I tried to look online to reset and everything, and I got a new one after two weeks of failed revival. I told my pastor that he can throw it in the dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: armstrongawm

customer_reviews.title: Beware Ink Prices
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine printer, capable scanner and copier, but, the cost of ink is outrageous and the option to down-set the printing to a low-ink usage "draft mode" is often unavailable in Mac software. And like many printers, it will fight you if you are out of a color, but want to print B&W (when you do have black ink). It's really a fine printer...just be sure you can handle replacing the 5 ink cartridges for close to the price of the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this printer! Used lightly for less than a year, suddenly got a U052 error code, was told by customer service (what a joke) to replace printer head which cost more than the entire unit purchase price or they would assist me in purchasing a new one. No thanks, back to HP for me. Was never entirely pleased with the print quality anyway. Too bad I just bought a ton of replacement inks.
customer_reviews.author: Janese Freye

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! A wonderful buy
customer_reviews.text: So far this is an awesome buy! The wifi is not lightning fast but I don't have it for a business so I don't need it to print in 5 seconds. It takes about 25 to 30 seconds to print through wifi which I think is fine. It is SUPER STURDY, and heavy, very solid. I like that, design is beautiful and simple. Screen is great, the ink cartridges are awesome!! SO EASY TO PUT THEM IN! Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and for the price, how can you go wrong? I definitely recommend at least trying this printer!
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Goog for a year or so of very7 lite printing.
customer_reviews.text: The printer and scanner worked greate -- for a little while. The print function stopped working even though the clean cycle clearly spit out enough ink. Then, the device would not completely turn on because of a printer startup error so even the scan function stopped working. It should be noted that there was a class action law suit the was successful against Canon for the printer problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Berman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working out of the blue. I barely use ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working out of the blue. I barely use this thing and now I'm stuck with the dreaded U052 error code. Canon won't repair or replace it and is sending me to a third party repair center that wants to charge me $90 to fix/replace the print head. Lol I can buy a brand new printer for around that much. NEVER BUYING ANOTHER CANON PRODUCT EVER AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: NYCguy

customer_reviews.title: 2 year life span
customer_reviews.text: This just died today after 2 and a half years. It is a sad day in the printer world. I didn't abuse it. I actually kept it clean and used it very mildly. The issue: when I turn it on it says there was a printer error and to contact the service center. It is basically a huge paper holding paper weight now. When it was alive it printed pretty nice pictures. I'd give it 7 out of 10 for photo quality and 5 out of 10 for speed as it took a long time to warm up before serving my prints.
customer_reviews.author: telemachus

customer_reviews.title: ... hours on it and the print head has gone bad. Only payed $129 for the whole printer
customer_reviews.text: 3 years old maybe 20 hours on it and the print head has gone bad. Only payed $129 for the whole printer, they want $99 for the head. I order a new printhead and the thing still won't print. I'll never buy another canon!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-function unit
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived well packaged from Amazon, probably from a local warehouse in only a day. It scans well with OCR; it copies well, either in color or black and white; it prints well with decent speed. In other words, the print head, software and mechanical functions are very smooth. I got about 400 pages from the printer. The color cartridges will not last as long. I've printed about three pages of 8 x 10 color and used about a third of the cartridge. At this time, I remain wary about using third party refills, and have ordered OEM refills. Overall, the product is very good for a reasonably priced inkjet, but I accept the high cost of OEM cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt

customer_reviews.title: Mostly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is an old-model used printer, and it works, but there were a couple of problems. First, it wasn't packaged very well--it could slide around in the box, and the tape used to keep the lid shut came off. When I first opened the box I was afraid the printer wouldn't work, but fortunately it does. The second problem is that there was no power cord with the printer. Fortunately, I had a compatible cord from another printer I already owned. If that were not the case, I could not have used this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Like everything about this printer except......
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't print when one of the inks run out. Everything about this printer is pretty nice, but when one of the blacks run out, the whole printer will discontinue to print. Having said that, I always keep extra ink on hand. Fairly easy to change the ink cartridge, although it took some time to figure out how the very first time I did it. Directions weren't as clear and easy as they could be, but otherwise we're very pleased with this printer and the quality of it. Copying turns out ice as well. Arrived very quickly too. We've been using this printer for a long time and have had no issues with it whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Sad for canon
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I've used canon products for 20 years, and this is by far the worst. We bought it because it had air print to connect with our iPad and iPhones, and at the time, there were not many to choose from. You cannot scan multiple documents at one time, it goes through ink quickly, its "best" high quality print is hardly good, and it cannot print in card stock. It gets caught on nearly every thickness of paper and causes ink streaks. Not a fan, will be replacing soon and probably with my first hp printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amie B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this multifunction machine to replace a Canon IP3000 which has worked very well. I wanted another Canon because the ink is so inexpensive compared to most other printers (thank you Abacus Ink!). This printer has worked very well in all its modes. Wireless is easy to set up and has worked flawlessly. The only complaint I have is that once in a while when the printer wakes up from sleep it is locked in whatever function it was in last and will not respond to any keys other than beep. It is easily resolved however by pushing the power button to turn it off and back on. Other than that, it has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Norm S

customer_reviews.title: Does not last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to print on DVD disc. It only lasted for about 300 disc and then the heads went out. If consider that a DVD disc is about the same as a 4X6 picture, you could only print a few hundred pictures before the head will be ruined. Just another piece of junk designed to be replaced to keep you buying more and more to stimulate the economy. Doesn't it feel great to know that you live in a country where you are an economic slave who's only function is to spend money to stimulate the economy; and if you won't do it voluntarily, they will just make things that don't last or force you to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Safari Man

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: It started out so well - great prints, great speed - multiple cartridges to minimize waste. But after one year - it's over. I got the dreaded codes of death (B200 and then U052). I could get one code to clear. I tried all the internet solutions without success. So into the trash heap it goes. One year! I'm starting to believe that it's best to by the cheapest printer possible and just throw it away instead of buying ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: PKR

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second MG5320 printer, the first one died two years after purchase and my second one just died on me today. I won’t even be contacting canon as they won’t do anything anyway. This is the last Canon product that I will ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matt.S

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like it ...
customer_reviews.text: So, I've had this printer for a year and nine months now. I really wanted to like it. Really, I did. But it goes through so much ink, and in the last six months I have had to really fight with it to get it to print blue. And now, it refuses to print in green and brown. I have cleaned the print heads. I have made sure the finicky thing has the right ink, and that the ink is full. And it doesn't matter. I would be better off getting ink for my old HP workhorse that I retired when I bought this one, and go back to using it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was a die hard HP user until I converted my home network to Apple. HP & Apple were not playing well together at that time, so I checked to see what Apple was selling on line which led me to this printer. I really like this machine. It works well with my windows 7 machines, along with the Apple. Ink seems to last longer than HP ever did. I use the scanner for photos & document scanning which goes very smoothly. I have only used the copy feature once, but it worked very nicely. I have been using this almost a year without a bit of problem. Honestly, I can't think of anything that I would change.
customer_reviews.author: AKVHutch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing all in one printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing. It works great wireless. The printing to disks option is what I bought it for and the disks look fantastic, which is the main reason I use it. It prints the disks fast also, though you have to manually change out each one. For printing disks I was not successful in figuring out how to use other programs like Photoshop or gimp to print onto disks but I did not try hard. I just make the layout in one of those programs then import it into the supplied software layout program. And for simple layouts I can use the supplied software.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Heart

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It scans well, prints well. I like that it has two trays, one below and one above/in back. This means I can have regular paper in the main tray and if I want to throw colored paper or photo paper in I don't need to change the existing paper. I also print easily from my ipad and iphone. I also like having the duplex option, resulting in double-sided prints with no fuss. My only complaint is the ink cartidges don't seem to last very long and also this printer takes a very long time to "warm up" if it hasn't printed in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bird

customer_reviews.title: OK, but the ink disappears into a parallel universe
customer_reviews.text: The printer itself is great, especially for the low price (good quality, reasonably fast), but I've only owned the printer for 13 months, and I've had to replace all of the 226 cartridges twice, and now the printer has notified me that two of them (cyan and magenta) are very low. I print almost exclusively in grayscale, and maybe 30 total pages per month (I still have a good bit of the 500-sheet ream of paper I bought with the printer). In other words, at $45.00 for a set of ink cartridges times two (about to be times three), I'll have paid substantially more for ink in 13 months than I paid for the printer.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Syndergaard

customer_reviews.title: A decent quality printer, but has had it's problems.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer for those on budget or just don't print that often for anything major. My family uses it for school, job applications, and the occasional photo. However my biggest problem so far is the printer has been printing in only green. Photos that we printed out came out green, and documents had green lining on words in big font. This problem has come up twice, and goes away after awhile. I looked up troubleshooting solutions, like cleaning the nozzle head using the built in software but it doesn't seem to be working. I would recommend looking into other printers before you try this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: and still no good. I removed and cleaned the printhead twice
customer_reviews.text: After two years of reliable service as an office printer, it just started printing blank sheets without any error on the screen or other indication. I ran all the cleaning cycles and head alignments, but the printer still spit out blank sheets. I replaced all the ink, since I had backup cartridges, and still no good. I removed and cleaned the printhead twice, and ink was definitely getting to the print head given how long it took before the water ran clear and seeing how the levels had decreased in the ink tanks. I liked this printer, and the old Pixma 4000 it replaced, but I won't be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine F. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Gobbles Ink - I miss my Canon iP4000
customer_reviews.text: Well, this does print very nicely but it grumbles and thinks about it 'forever' before it finally prints. We started using it about mid-January and 2 colors are already out! I think my husband printed one 4x6 picture and then we've just done some various things that are mostly text - less than 50 pages for sure. I used to print full color pages (background included) for a business I had on the old Pixma iP4000, and it really just sipped ink. The new ink cartridges have black sides so that you can't judge ink levels for yourself. It looks like I can buy a new print head for the iP4000, but it's as expensive as a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy W

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value for an excellent multi-function device
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer because I needed to print CD's but it can do so much more. We did our two page full color xmas letter on it, have copied our kid's medical records, printed CDs and more. Once it warms up (which can take up to 5 minutes of thinking and whirring and doing various things with the ink cartridges) it is very fast. Pages print in seconds, disks print flawlessly in about 20 seconds, and copying a page takes less than 10 seconds. Yes, it is an ink jet and so I'm guessing the cartridge cost will eventually get me but for what I needed it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tarbox

customer_reviews.title: Trash bound
customer_reviews.text: This printer is killing me. I bought it for the airprint feature and was very excited only to find out I had to do a firmware upgrade that took thirty minutes right out of the box. From that point it only went down hill. It randomly cuts off, take FOREVER to spit out a single page for all of the popping and clicking and thinking it seems to need to perform. It literally took 4 and a half minutes to print one page... and that's when it hasn't eaten all of the cartridges that it need to fulfill its job. This thing is going to the dump. Shame on you Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Westmoreland

customer_reviews.title: They sent me the wrong product...
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a Canon Pixma MG5320 printer, obviously, since that's what I ordered. I received the printer in the mail only to find that they sent me a completely different printer! They sent me a Canon MX410. I would have been more okay with it if it at least had some of the features that I bought the MG5320 for (Air Print, mostly), but it did not. What really annoyed me is that they shipped it in a MG5320 box! I emailed Milas Corp about it, and they sent me an MG 5320..except I never received it in the mail. Will not be buying from this merchant again. So frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish network printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer based on all the 4 and 5 star reviews it had, thinking it would be a good printer. The print quality is fine, but it disappears off the wireless network on a regular basis. When I try to shut it down using the menus it never completes the shutdown process and I have to pull the power plug. When I plug it back in, it complains that I interrupted the shutdown process and often does not reconnect without me having to redefine the Wi-Fi settings. I build Wi-Fi products and I'm rather disappointed at the poor Wi-Fi connectivity with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Price

customer_reviews.title: Goes through Ink like I go through underwear
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I just purchased this and have used it very little. However, I am already getting low ink warnings. I have never seen a printer use up the ink so quickly. I'm wondering if I was sent a "starter" kit of ink, but am very disappointed and hesitant to shell out more money so soon for new ink cartridges. Other than that, the printer is awesome. It's my first wi-fi printer and that functionality alone is worth it. Despite being a bit loud and a bit slow, the print quality is excellent (should be based on ink usage). I especially like the ability to print on cd/dvd's. I've done this twice with excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: El Duderino

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this printer Dec. 30 2011. No ...MG5320
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer Dec. 30 2011. No problem until two days ago. An error UO52 disabled it completely with no remedy to fix or repair. Canon support is non existent. A class action lawsuit is now in progress against Canon USA Inc. Class action filed by Michael Robertson. Robertson vs Canon USA, Case No 1:14-cv-00607-ss in US District in the Western district of Tx. 170 comments complaining of this problem on various models of Canon Printers.
customer_reviews.author: ted crace

customer_reviews.title: Love using a wireless printer now!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very techy, so it was a little complicated for me to get this set up. But I managed and I love the convenience of wireless printing! I don't print photos. I just use it for basic color and black/white text documents. It prints very nicely on the fast-print feature which really saves on ink. This printer also accepts the Sophia Global Compatible Ink Cartridges (available through Amazon) which cost a fraction of the Canon-brand ink and perform great in this printer.
customer_reviews.author: annie bananie

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's wireless, I can print from my desktop, laptop, or Iphone. Does have lots a cartridges that are small, but we just make sure we have a refill pack on hand at all times. There are two black inks, one large and one smaller. It still printed when the smaller inks ran out. Smaller printer than my last big clunky one. Oh and didn't try to print when the larger black ink ran out, but we use it for personal use . If you want a printer for professional use, I would say to buy a printer built for professional use...which means it'll cost you more.
customer_reviews.author: Terri G

customer_reviews.title: Prints great photos, but has some annoyances
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints great photos there's no doubt about it, and the menus are easy to navigate. One complaint I have is that for some reason it takes forever to start feeding the paper. It sounds like it's getting ready to feed the paper, but it takes forever to start going through. It also goes through a ton of ink, but that's expected with photo printers. If you want a printer that prints great photos but you don't mind waiting for the paper to start feeding than this printer is for you.
customer_reviews.author: taxidriver1138

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 3 years of very light use. Drinks ink more than I drink water. Am not a dehydrated person. Why would the cyan needs to be replaced if I have am printing mostly black and white. Almost feels like I have to replace one of the 5 cartridges once every 10 pages.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Love that it's wireless
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's wireless, but you can only choose black and white option for .pdfs (so if you're printing from a color email or a webpage you're stuck with full color) and the photos print horribly - which is a shame because that's why I bought the thing to begin with. Anything I print has a serious red hue to it. Maybe it's operator failure, but I've cleaned the heads a number of times and can't find anywhere to re calibrate it, so I'm giving this one star.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: CD label printing !
customer_reviews.text: I bought printer this because I wanted to print on cds. It does an excellent job, I have been using TDK full face printable cds. I do my own artwork and transfer it to a memory stick . Printer will also copy the disc label from the original disc to your copy. Set up and understanding the operation was fairly easy. This beats lightscribe and paper labels (my former m.o.'s) by a long shot. Canon is a good brand. I will be spending good money on inks but I am happy with his printer and feel it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Bad power board
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful printer, so long as it works. Great paper handling, excellent color rendering. BUT, one day (for me it was at 14 months) the printer will go dark and then it is done. Apparently there is a defect in the power board; if you Google this model you will find scores of complaints on this issue. If you're OK with this, you will love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Marge in WI

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We got this printer to replace our HP because we were tired of the multi color ink cartridges. We wanted something that had the single color ink so we could replace them individually. Sadly, that is the best thing about this printer. The photo quality is terrible compared to our HP and the colors are off. Every picture comes out slightly tinted blue. Based on the reviews, I expected this to be a great printer, but it just isn't. Saving money on ink doesn't justify the poor print quality, so it looks like we'll be going back to HP.
customer_reviews.author: NoAdditives

customer_reviews.title: Always buy Canon printers
customer_reviews.text: My last canon printer was awesome, I never wanted to part with it but my mother in law needed one and we were moving, so she got lucky. The benefits of this particular canon printer is individual ink cartridges for each color... This saves you a lot of money long term. The wireless works great, the interface is easy to work with and it works every time the first time. I did IT through college and we did a lot of work on HP printers... They're such crap compared to Canon in terms of these personal / small office printers it's a joke.
customer_reviews.author: th3byrdm4n

customer_reviews.title: Buy an entended warranty
customer_reviews.text: Nice printer,does great on printable dvd's, photo's look really good. However it doesn't last.4 months after the warranty expired it quit working with an error code B200.Replacing the ink and also removing and cleaning the print head had no effect. This unit was on the first set of replacement ink cartridges.I printed a color picture once at least every two weeks to keep the ink head from drying out.. A new print head costs $12 more than a new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Welch

customer_reviews.title: Classy looking
customer_reviews.text: I found it very easy to install although I wasn't used to the paper being loaded in the bottom, reviewed the instructions, followed the directions and it works perfectly. I try to do all my printing in one session as each time I turn it on, it takes several minutes to go through the process of being ready to print. I took away one star as I didn't receive a booklet of instructions which is so handy for someone my age (very senior) and not familiar with all the new technology, but I'll figure it out. Love the size, very compact.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: OK, But Died After a Few Years of Normal Use.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect it to last more than a few years. Eats ink like crazy. Makes a lot of clunky noises. Prints on CD's which is hard to find on printers anymore. When it was new, it made excellent prints.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Pan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to work wireless, had to return it
customer_reviews.text: I picked this because of pretty good reviews and good price, and my previous printer was a very similar Canon which worked good for 4 years. I had trouble getting this one set up to work wireless, it finally did work but then quit after a week. I tried getting it set up via Bluetooth, worked sporadically and then just stopped. After reading some negative reviews about the wireless dependability, I decided to just return it since it was less than 30 days, rather than risk that it would never work reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Snow

customer_reviews.title: Short lived printer
customer_reviews.text: It stopped printing after less than 10 months. The cost of repairing it is almost as much as its original cost and there are very few authorized repair facilities near me. UPDATE: It turns out the printer heads were clogged and nothing else was wrong with the printer. After I cleaned it with Print Head Clog Buster, it started printing again just fine. In future I'll be more diligent about turning the machine off properly. Overall, it's an ok printer for the price, though it uses quite a bit of ink.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha Tabby

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer, feels like it burns through ink
customer_reviews.text: My one complaint is that this printer seems to burn through ink, but then again, what relatively-inexpensive printer doesn't? Love the wireless connectivity (very useful given that my wife and I only use laptops, iPads and an iPhone for printing) and the setup is pretty easy. I haven't personally done a lot of scanning but my wife has, and she figured it out pretty quickly. She's not clueless by any means but she often asks for my help to speed along the "figuring it out" phase in these types of situations so the fact that she didn't says something about how consumer-friendly this product is.
customer_reviews.author: Shark Gillins

customer_reviews.title: Canon Wireless Inkjet MG5320 -- Good Value and Able Performer
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an older Cannon Pixma printer with this new wireless model. Thus far we are very satisfied with the new model and we appreciate the convenience of wireless printing and accessible photocopying and scanning. THe quality of printed photos is excellent, as is all other printing. At this early stage, there are two unknowns -- durability of printer and ink consumption. But in all ways to date, the Canon MG5320 is a fine performer. The purchasing at Amazon.com was painless and a highly efficient process,as is typically the case.
customer_reviews.author: jde

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a new printer because i couldn't print wirelessly anymore with my old one. Nowadays you have to be able to print from your iPad or iPhone. This printer took a little time to set up, but it was simple and clearly explained. It comes taped together and you have to set up everything yourself. In the end it turns out to be a beautiful addition to your office, and works seamlessly. My whole family was impressed with its quality of printing, as well as the ease of use. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to step up a notch.
customer_reviews.author: TheMom50

customer_reviews.title: Software installation fiasco
customer_reviews.text: When it works, this is a decent low-end product -- flimsy and slow, of course, but that's expected for the price. I would have rated this much higher until my computer died, and I needed to reinstall the software. Windows 8 installation isn't working at all, and web search tells me I'm not alone in this problem. Windows 7 installation on my laptop sort of worked, but the software is insisting I run as Administrator for it to work, and I don't like to do that for security reasons. There are other software difficulties as well. The above complaints refer to document scanning. For printing and copying I've found the PIXMA reliable but slow.
customer_reviews.author: SatinSteel

customer_reviews.title: Just bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this printer, it has everything i want it to have. The best part is that it can print pictures which with my scrapbooking may be cheaper than printing my pictures elsewhere and a lot more convinent. I love the print quality and the instructions are super easy. If your looking for a do it all printer with great style and great quaility, get this! I have no problems and the wireless printing is amazing feature. I love not having to be plugged right next to the printer! ahhh i;m in love
customer_reviews.author: kelseyb

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. I really like this printer. Simple to set up. A little confusing to operate, but that might be related to where I've located it -- on an upper shelf on my computer desk above my head. I have to stand on tiptoe to press the buttons. Other than that, I've had the MG5320 for almost a year now and I haven't had any problems. Print quality is good. It copies well and scans well. When it comes to personal printers for home use, I much prefer Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle in Minneapolis

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 issue filled years! Its out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Dead after 2 issue filled years! Its out of warranty but we searched online and this an ongoing issue with the printer head. There's a new class action lawsuit on canon about these specific printers, so I'd highly suggest staying away from the pixma series.
customer_reviews.author: ShopsWay2Much

customer_reviews.title: Canon MG5320: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Mine just stopped working and won't even turn on after 1 year and 10 months. Just dead. It looks like I just bought it, used it weekly to monthly, never got a chance to use the scanner. I have had to buy ink about 4 times; it guzzles ink. And now, not even two years and it's a shiny doorstop. I don't even think I will repair it...just go one and buy a good one. So disappointing as I had an HP All in One that lasted for fifteen years. It was just finally done in by the change in technology. I am totally disappointed in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Unplanned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same unsolvable issue a number of other people have had- the printer worked just beyond the warranty period and then began printing blank pages. Aside from the ON light, which doesn't come on, it responds exactly as if everything is ok, even making printing sounds, but nothing appears. Mindless tech people have told everyone to try the same fixes, none of which have any effect on the issue. More Canon landfill.
customer_reviews.author: ericwal

customer_reviews.title: Great printing, but short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent printer and makes good prints with minimal feed problems, but just barely one year after purchase it suddenly and I mean suddenly stopped working...no power getting to the machine. It turned one and less than one minute later it is off and I tried everything and it is just dead. For a $100 printer THAT is unacceptable and for the name Canon it should also be unacceptable. Going back to HP I think. My experience is that they are built to last and priced well.
customer_reviews.author: Swirian

customer_reviews.title: i've scanned and scanned and scanned and it's worked great. i don't print out too much since we ...
customer_reviews.text: not sure if i've written a review before, but i've had this printer/scanner for a while (almost three years) and it has held up and done what i need it to do - no probs. i've scanned and scanned and scanned and it's worked great. i don't print out too much since we live in an electronic world but when i do print out it is ready pronto. def recommend this printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Good Stuff

customer_reviews.title: OK but
customer_reviews.text: This printer is my second Pixma and first AirPrint model. It works great with my IPad an IMac. Once I put them both on my home (AT&T U- VERSE) network I had conflicts. Canon's tech support has spent hours over 3 days trying to resolve the conflicts. The problem was my windows 7 -64 PC lost connectivity once the PC was turned off. It took many steps to restore connectivity and some Canon agents were more proficient then others. My case was usually bumped up to a senior agent. I am still happier with Canon than I ever was with Hp.
customer_reviews.author: Kazap

customer_reviews.title: My Best Amazon purchase of recent years.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite Amazon purchases of recent years. Much less costly than other DVD Label printing options. I find it helpful in making Flyers , booklets, also, much to my pleasant surprise. About 50 seconds to print one DVD. Maybe not the speediest but still a better option than buying a DVD Label-er for +$1,000.00. Very good for smaller to medium events. The wireless connection a better option than I was thinking.
customer_reviews.author: ZIM OLSON

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the Canon Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just over 2 years ago. It worked fine until a few weeks ago. The message was wrong print head which must mean someone unknown to me changed it, of course that didn't happen. It's a bad product, and now I have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Pop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer.
customer_reviews.text: The wireless part is really slow, makes you wonder if you actually hit the "print" button at all. Quality is amazing. Price i paid 90 when i got mine, so it was good. As far as the ink being wasted, i see what some reviewers were talking about. But all new printers do that now. Printer companies don't make money on printers, they make money on ink. Not sure how it would be for people who print tons of pages, but for light school work, and occasional usage it's really good.
customer_reviews.author: vinny

customer_reviews.title: Failed at 21 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my excellent Canon MP600 so I could have wi-fi remote printing for an iPad. Printing was very good for photos, etc. Unfortunately, all printing failed at 21 months, and there was no guidance to fix it other than much nozzle cleaning. I would give it 1 star, but I was using non OEM ink, but then again the ink had a large number of positive reviews and I tried different cartridges to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Easy Setup, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've had mostly HP printers all my life, but after my last one broke after about a year, I decided to try Canon. I've only had this printer for a few days, but I am very satisfied so far. The print quality and speed are excellent, and the features on this mid-range printer are excellent. I have nothing bad to say about it. I love that it works with Apple AirPrint. At first I couldn't get that to work, but the support page at Canon said that I had to update the firmware. That was easy, and now I have easy printing right from my iPad. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat quality or price for this duplex.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike. Sure, when first used during a session, it takes time to get its stuff together, then there is no more delay. This is not a 'con', as suggested by others...It is not 'instant gratification" as required by those who complain. Easy set up (I hard wired it). Duplex is perfect. Delivered on the second day. How does Amazon do it? The price...the quality...the delivery. This whole machine cost less than the re-fill ink for my previous brand new HP (which I gave to my grndson). My second Canon...and I am sticking with that brand!
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Waitt Esq.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, saves paper
customer_reviews.text: I love the double sided printing on standard size paper. While you can feed legal size paper through the rear paper chute, the double sided printing will not function in this mode. The wireless printing makes locating the printer easier and allows multiple users to access the printer without a tangle of cables. Ink consumables are much lower cost than my previous hp printer. 3/2/15 Update: Printer has died and was told it would cost more to fix than replacing with a new model. Unfortunately I had just stocked up on ink that won't work in my new Pixma 5522. :(
customer_reviews.author: Don Holden

customer_reviews.title: Two years in, dead as a doornail
customer_reviews.text: Got a B200 error randomly one day, tried some troubleshooting steps (i.e. turn it on while the cover is open), and it's completely shot. Won't power on or anything. Disappointed that not only will I have to get a new printer, but that my recent purchase of ink refills was a complete waste as well. Worked OK when it was alive.
customer_reviews.author: BMovieBen

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless feature but lacks when printing pictures
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these because of the WiFi printing feature. That part works great! But when it comes to printing pictures, this is were this printer comes up short. Pictures aren't crisp. Seem very dull and colors are bland :( I am going to keep one so we can print from our iPads and Macbook Air at home. But not a printer for serious photo printing. I think documents and random kid printing for my son will be ok for this printer. And at $69.00 during a deal of the day can't go wrong. sold the other printer for $90.00 So really only had to spend 49 for this.
customer_reviews.author: Garry969

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second PIXMA printer and so far, so good... that said, I had a terrible experience with my other one only lasting two years with only moderate printing load. The print head had jammed on the other one. I am hoping this one doesn't have that problem. Why did I purchase another? It's one of the only printers for printing with edible inks for my cake decorating business. I'll update this review in a year.
customer_reviews.author: R. Buchholz

customer_reviews.title: Printer died from the old B200 error. Never again Canon..
customer_reviews.text: The printer just died on me with the dreaded B200 error. (Normal family use - photos, homework, etc..) Seems this is a very common issue with Canon printers and after hours trying everything on the web to fix it, I finally threw it in the trash. Going back to Epson which have always been good to me in the past.
customer_reviews.author: honest reviewer guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from my HP
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this when my HP died. The HP was forever preparing and when trying to make a quick copy before running out the door it was annoying. This new canon is great. My wife loves the duplexing feature to save paper and that you don't have to reload the paper tray to print on the other side. It is very quick to print or copy when requested. The ink tanks are smaller than the HP so it seems to use ink quicker but the cost is much less if using non-OEM inks. Just keep extra ink tanks on hand
customer_reviews.author: Harvey W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this printer the other day and I love it. Set up was fast and easy and configuring the wireless connection only took me a little while. Now I can print from my Ipad and Iphone instantly. I also love how this printer prints on CD's and DVD's. It also copies and scans. Canon printers also play nicely with the third party ink cartridges that I buy, which saves me a fortune. The shiny black exterior will need to be dusted frequently, but it looks really nice when clean.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Literally evil
customer_reviews.text: It's a reasonably decent printer, but it's unforgivable that in this day and age you can't print a black and white document if only one of your color ink cartridges is empty. There's just no way around it. For previous models you could force it to print black-only using Printer Preferences, but the driver for this model has removed that option. Why make a product less convenient for your customers? So you can sell more over-priced ink. And now I'm going to miss a deadline because of corporate greed. Thanks, Canon!
customer_reviews.author: essrog

customer_reviews.title: Initial Issue Quickly Resolved
customer_reviews.text: When we received our Canon PIXMA originally we had a slew of issues that were really frustrating and after working with the troubleshooting determined it to be a faulty printer. We contacted Canon who had my wife jump through the same procedures to verify what we were saying and then they sent out a new model two-day air, which was nice. Once we got a functioning all-in-one it's worked out very well. The scan function is easily the most used and is a simple procedure on our mac. I'd recommend this all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie H

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-one photo printer for my simple needs
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this printer. I am a rather minimal user, but for my basic needs of occasional printing, scanning, and photo printing, I've had no problems. Setup was easy and quick, wireless has been "hook up and forget", printing is quick and good quality, especially the photos, for which I'll have no need to go to any photo printing place. I like the compactness of the printer - it folds up when not in use (which is often for me) and even when running it doesn't need much extra space or weird feed trays sticking far out. I've had for about a year now and it's been going great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Goldin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: We got this after our HP wireless all in one took a fall when we moved and was dead. We researched HP, Kodak and Canon and it seems the ink for the Canon will be MUCH cheaper and this got good reviews. It was SUPER easy to set up (a FIRST with any printer I've owned) and getting the wireless running was fast and easy, as well. My husband loves that he can print from his iPhone. The quality seems good. We'll see how things go with the ink and how long it lasts, but so far we are pleased!
customer_reviews.author: E. P. B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very compact and a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to us by our computer tech guy. It works well (the auto shut-off feature is nice too) and is very compact. We used to have an HP all-in-one and it was considerably larger and slower, too. We've had this product for well over a year and use it quite often. So far, no problems. For the price, it's a good quality product that will last awhile. It's easy to use and change the cartridges, too.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Pixma MG5320 Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Like the paper tray aspect, keeps the paper clean versus the other Pixma (MP450) which had the paper out in the open. Replaced that MP450 with this one since the other one kept jamming. The duplex function on this is nice as is the wireless. Have this on the wireless network and can send it print jobs from the laptop without a problem. 14 pound cats can sit on the top without causing a problem other than occasionally activating a control.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was pretty easy to set up and came with clear directions in how to get it up and running. I had it connected to all my devices soon out of the box. The print quality it everything I hoped for and it prints clear pictures. Better than what I was expecting for the price. The ink that it came with lasted through about 8 months of use before running low, and that includes a period of time I tried to be a crazy coupon lady. I'm happy with printer and it's ease of use
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Best printer ever
customer_reviews.text: I mean I could go on and on about this printer but let me just list my favorites: WIFI printing, easy no hassle setup and connects with all computer Print directly from a SD card (lcd screen offers great navigation) Phenomenal Quality Cheap replacement ink also available on amazon I love how the paper supply is hidden and also the flap which opens automatically when you print.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our HP printer. That was our second HP printer. Our first lasted for years! So we went with HP again, and were sadly disapointed. That printer didn't last a year. Constant paper jams and cartridge jams had us wanting to throw it out the window. We finally broke down and bought this printer. We love our Canon camera, so we decided to try a Canon printer. We're glad we did. This printer has been going strong! Moslty for home office use. Lots of extras, and a nice price. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DogDayz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: 1. Duplex printing. Printed a 176 page document double-sided with no problems 2. Separate ink cartridges allows me to replace one color when its empty. Will recognize non-Canon ink. 3. Connected to the network easily and have not had trouble with connections since purchase (~6 months) 4. Paper capacity of the tray is decent. Probably holds at least 100 pages of 24 lb paper. Loving the printer so far and so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: stargazer2190

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for the ability to print wirelessly from our Apple devices and it has not disappointed. Owned it now for over 7 years and still a great, reliable printer/copier/scanner. I'm glad I bought it when I did because it was only $115.00 brand new. I can't believe that it's $800+ now. WTH! It's a great $115.00 printer. This is ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Cole Night Trane

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer for two reasons, ability to print on printable CD/DVDs, and for it's wireless capability. I have been very satisfied with both. Most of my printing so far has been photographic and the quality is extrememly good. The only negative I have found is some difficulty understanding the directions on how to print to a CD/DVD, and a rather long time for the printer to get ready to print. Once it is ready, print speed is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Considering that I paid about half the retail $ on this is amazing! Does everything you need Print - Scan - Copy - all wirelessly. You can use multiple free online websites to fax documents as well (or $ service to get a fax number to receive as well). The .pdf and photo printing capabilities are great. You can connect it via USB to a local connection, but why would you?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Peterson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for maybe a year. Prints well but does take a while when first turned on. I make my own cards and print out photos. Have had many compliments on my work so no complaints on the print quality. Ink is expensive so I use a generic brand which seems to have worked well. So far the best printer I've had and it was a really good price. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deema

customer_reviews.title: WiFi made easy
customer_reviews.text: Easiest printer setup I've ever had. Within 10 minutes I had 2 PCs desktops, a PC notebook, a PC laptop, a Mac, an Ipad, two iphones, an android tablet and an Android phone printing to it without a single issue. Didn't even have to hook up a USP at any point. Looks great, software is easy. UI is easy. Ink replacement easy. Photos awesome. My only con is the small paper tray, but I don't do volume printing anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but Slow to Start
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful compact printer. My only problem with it is starting a print job and having to wait several hours for it. In the meantime I have pressed 'print' 4 or 5 times so hours later that's what I got 5 or more copies using up my ink. Oh well. Somehow I'll figure this glitch out. I haven't tried printing again right after maybe once it gets warmed up everything will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Haas

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Printer by Cannon
customer_reviews.text: This is another great printer by Cannon. It takes a while for the 1st print of the day, but if you know you are going to be printing, just power it up about 5 mins before you want to print. It is not a loud printer, other reviews talk about it being noisie, not at all. It has a quiet mod that I have no reason to try. Wireless works great too. I set up 3 computers with no problems, 1 Windows 7, 1 XP, and 1Vista. The kids call it the Robo printer because the front door opens automaticly. It prints great too. Amazon had the best price and shipped it fast.
customer_reviews.author: Caveman

customer_reviews.title: didnt work
customer_reviews.text: this product was a complete rip off. it didn't work at all and I didn't realize it until a month later since I didn't have use for it for a while. when I found out, the seller refused to refund me. It may be my fault for noticing too late.
customer_reviews.author: Nisi

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have seen printers with better printing quality out there, but for a wireless printer in what I would call economy pricing I think it's fine for what it is. I've only had it for about a month now but its had a fair amount of use and so far no problems. One of the reasons I got this unit was the fact that I was able to find printer cartrages around the internet for very resonable prices. My last printer was an Epson and that was definatly not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy... to many issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer over a year ago. Once it is set up it work ok, but it will continuously say that cannot find printer, or that printer is in use even though it is not. It requires you to restart you pc, reinstall the drivers to work again. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: Very nice all-in-one unit
customer_reviews.text: It works well. The only drawback is the software that comes with the scanner; it is difficult to override when one wishes to do things differently than what is the norm from the producers of the software expect. However, the printer works well and, once one figures out how to overcome the software's limitations, scans fine, as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arms

customer_reviews.title: Great printer.....but
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked Canon inkjet printers. The printer was extremely easy to setup and configure with the wireless connection. The print and photo quality are very good. The scanner/copier is really nice, love the option to copy with involving the computer. The ink containers are the only let down. These are smaller than the ones i have used in prior Canon printers, thus they run out faster. The prices are the same, so it seems i am paying more for less quantity. Would like to have the option of having larger ink containers.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Emert

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this printer when I got it. I had it for 18 months and it died this week I called Canon and they said that it needs a new part that will cost $80-$100. I do not do a significant amount of printing and this should not have a happened so soon. Either way, I think it is a good printer, but beware of a very short lifespan. If you don't want to have to buy another printer in 18 months, think twice before purchasing this Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Canon printer
customer_reviews.text: I got it on a amazon sale because it is wireless.. Prints good and fairly easy wi fii connection only bad thing it that it needs lots of tint cartridges (blue, magenta, black, yellow, another black) and they might be expensive. Since i do not print a lot is not a problem for me, but could have been a decision maker before getting it. I like that i am able to send to print from my cellphone or ipad.
customer_reviews.author: V. Rivera

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MG5320 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-in-One Printer (5291B019)
product_meta.description:
The PIXMA MG5320 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One delivers superior quality, versatility, and ease of use. Built-in Wi-Fi technology allows you to easily print and scan wirelessly virtually anywhere around your house. Print gorgeous, borderless photos at home up to 8.5-inch x 11-inch size with a maximum print color resolution of 9600 x 2400 dpi and five individual ink tanks. Have all new sorts of fun with your images by adding new effects like Fish Eye, Miniature, Toy Camera, Soft Focus and Blur Background before you print. Enjoy a new sphere of printing options as PIXMA Cloud Link lets you conveniently print pictures from online photo albums CANON iMAGE GATEWAY and Picasa as well as templates including seasonal stationary and calendars from a compatible Canon PIXMA Wireless All-in-One, all without a computer. With AirPrint, wirelessly print photos, emails, web pages and other documents without the need to install device drivers, saving time and making for a seamless user experience. Built-in Auto Duplex Printing allows you to automatically print on both sides of the paper and can help reduce paper usage and cost by up to 50%. The MG5320 also lets you print on your CD, DVD and Blu-ray Discs, and you can even turn your HD Movie clips into beautiful photos.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The beautiful PIXMA MG5320 Wireless Inkjet Photo All-In-One delivers superior quality, versatility, and ease of use. Built-in Wi-Fi®1 technology allows you to easily print and scan wirelessly virtually anywhere around your house. Print gorgeous, borderless2 photos at home up to 8.5" x 11' size with a maximum print color resolution of 9600 x 2400 dpi3 and five individual ink tanks. 

Have all new sorts of fun with your images by adding new effects like Fish Eye, Miniature, Toy Camera, Soft Focus and Blur Background before you print. Enjoy a new sphere of printing options as PIXMA Cloud Link lets you conveniently print pictures from online photo albums Canon Image Gateway and Picasa as well as templates including seasonal stationary and calendars from a compatible Canon PIXMA Wireless All-in-One, all without a computer. Built-in Auto Duplex Printing allows you to automatically print on both sides of the paper and can help reduce paper usage and cost by up to 50%. The MG5320 also lets you print on your CD, DVD and Blu-ray Discs, and you can even turn your HD Movie clips into beautiful photos.

View beautiful, easy-to-view scans by advanced image analysis and area-by-area data correction, automatically. Plus, you can print and scan jpeg and pdf files wirelessly from compatible iPad, iPhone, iPod touch, and Android devices4 without a computer. And, enjoy direct printing options from compatible memory cards5, USB Flash Drives6, PictBridge and optional Bluetooth devices.7 

OVERVIEW


For the 9th year in a row, Canon U.S.A. is proud to have received the 2012 Readers' Choice Award for Service & Reliability from PCMag.com for Printers.* 

*A trademark of Ziff Davis, Inc. Used under license. Reprinted with permission. Copyright. 2012 Ziff Davis, Inc. All rights reserved. 


Click here for a larger image PIXMA MG5320 WIRELESS INKJET PHOTO ALL-IN-ONE
 

Advanced Wireless1 Photo All-In-One Printer with 3.0" LCD

 * Full HD Movie Print software turns your favorite HD movie clips captured with your compatible Canon EOS Digital SLR or PowerShot cameras into beautiful prints8
 * Maximum 9600 x 2400 color dpi print resolution with microscopic ink droplets as small as 1 picoliter3
 * Print photos from your compatible iPad, iPhone, iPod touch and Android Devices with the free Easy-PhotoPrint printing app4
 * Built-in CD/DVD Printing
 * Keep it eco-conscious: Built-in 2-sided printing helps the environment and cuts your paper usage by up to 50%
   





FEATURES & BENEFITS

 

SPEED & QUALITY




Superior Resolution:
9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi3 firing with 1pl produces incredible quality and detail in both your borderless photos, crafts, business documents and web pages. 


High Performance, Five Individual Ink Tank System:
This 5-color ink system consists of four dye-based inks for superb color and detail. A pigment-based black ink produces exceptionally crisp text. Plus, only replace the color ink tank that runs out. 

Print Beautiful, Borderless Photos, Fast:
Print a borderless, 4" x 6" photo in approximately 20 seconds9.


Print Documents and Web Pages, Fast:
Print documents and web pages with fast speeds of 12.5 images per minute (ipm) for black and 9.3 images per minute (ipm) for color10. 


ChromaLife100+:
This system combines enhanced FINE print head technology with select genuine Canon inks and select genuine Canon photo papers for beautiful borderless photos that will last up to 300 years when stored in an archival-quality photo album11.

 

EASE OF USE



Full HD Movie Print:
Full HD Movie Print software turns HD movie clips captured with your compatible Canon EOS Digital SLR or PowerShot cameras into beautiful photo prints.8 


Fun Filter Effects:

Built-in CD and DVD Printing:

Auto Photo Fix II:

So, unexposed areas of the photo will be optimized, area by area and faces that are backlit and under-exposed will automatically be brightened with correct color cast to help ensure more accurate skin tones for gorgeous images.

Hyoun Kim5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Printer - Worth Every Penny - A FEW CAVEATS - READ!!Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2012Verified Purchase I've owned an HP color LaserJet for quite some time now, but the only problem is that is streaks. Something is wrong with the fuser/toner cartridges and despite me getting a local printer/copier technician to look at it, he thinks it can't be fixed. Not wanting to spend any more money trying to get it repaired, I'm just holding onto it until the toner runs out.

But recently, my my wife is planning on going back to college. Back to college means writing papers, printing out stuff, and all that jazz and she needed a printer that didn't have a huge streak going down each sheet. On top of that, she wanted a printer that was capable of copying/scanning. Having procrastinated for a while now, I did notice that another Canon Pixma (PIXMA MG6220) was the Gold Box Deal of the Day. That printer retailed $199.99 but was on sale for $59.99. Instead of pulling the trigger on it, I decided to wait until she woke up. Unfortunately, that printer sold out lightning fast. When I checked back, some kind of Toshiba laptop was the replacement product. She was upset, but told me to keep an eye out for another deal. Luckily, I checked Amazon that night and saw this printer (PIXMA MG5320) replaced that Toshiba laptop. The only difference is that it was the model down and was $2 cheaper. Not willing to lose out on it, I pulled the trigger.

[ COMPARISONS ]
Comparing the whitepaper documents on the MG5320 vs the MG6220 I lost out on earlier that day, they seem to do the EXACT same thing (print speeds, DPI, duplex printing, etc) with the exception of 4 things:
1) 5 individual inks vs 6 individual inks (the MG6220 has the gray cartridge)
2) a non-touch screen vs touch screen (big whoop)
3) No Ethernet (WiFi Only) vs Ethernet + WiFi (oh no)
4) No Google Cloud Print Ready vs Google Cloud Print Ready (I have easily bypassed this to make it available on my printer).

So for 3 out of 4 functions missing, was it worth $2 (gold box price difference)? Yes. Is it worth $50 price difference (if you bought it retail)? Probably not.

[ SETUP ]
From unboxing to setup completion, it took me about 35 minutes. That setup includes removing all the tape/wrapping, putting in the ink cartridges in, powering it on, connecting it to my PC via USB, and then running the calibration steps required before actual printing. Since I connected it via USB, I have Windows 7 and it automatically recognized the printer and set it up for me. Of course, my wife likes having those diagnostic tools/software that comes with printers, so I installed that on my computer. I will say it's not as bad as past software/tools from previous printers I owned (Lexmark & HP). It's less bulky and the software is less intrusive. It's less "bloatware" than other bloatware drivers that usually accompany printers.

As long as you have Wifi in your home, setting it up is a breeze. All you need to know is your wifi network's SSID and the password. That's it. Type those in correctly and it will join your network and allows you to utilize Google Cloud Printing, Airprinting, printing over the network.

[ PRINTING ]
In terms of printing you have the option of regular paper (on the bottom tray) or photo paper (on the top tray). There is a CD tray for printing onto CD/DVDs/etc (you must have a printable CD-R/DVD-R). So as long as you buy those disc, you never have to buy one of those label stickers.

Printing on plain paper (I just use generic copier paper for my HP Laserjet) is as good as printing with an inkjet gets. If you're wanting crisper text, you need to invest in paper that doesn't bleed as much. Remember, I'm going from a laser printer (which fuses toner) to an inkjet that sprays ink onto paper. Obviously my Laserjet looks crisper, but I can fix that by getting higher quality paper.

Photo printing is awesome. With the printer came a sample pack of about 10 4 x 6 sheets. If you're wondering what it is specifically, it is theCanon Photo Paper Plus Glossy II, 4 x 6 Inches, 100 Sheets (2311B023) . Having printed photos dozens of times at CVS, Walgreens, and Walmart, the quality of the photos are as good as ones you get professionally done. HOWEVER, there are a few things I need to point out.
1. This printer is a 9600 maximum dpi printer. The higher the dpi when you print photos on photo quality paper, the higher the detail.
2. When you print photos, you need EXCELLENT quality photos AKA straight from the digital camera or high megapixel camera. My wife tried to print a couple photos she pulled from Facebook. They looked absolutely horrible due to the compression that Facebook does by default unless you check the option to upload in high resolution. This option is *ONLY* available on Facebook's webpage. The mobile versions do not allow you to do this. Because of that, the majority of floating facebook photos out there are not in high quality. Again, the artifacts (square blocks, uneven colors/detail) from compression (like the photos on facebook) will be very very visible when you print on high resolution and/or photo paper.

Other printing features (such as templates) are bundled in the application (on the setup CD) and also on built into the printer itself. Such templates include the following: calendars, photo albums, lined papers (such as notebook paper, graph paper, checklist paper, agendas, etc).

[ OTHER FEATURES ]
Google Cloud Print - This is fairly a new technology and even myself, a frequent user of Google technologies, rarely use this. I just don't see it as useful to print to my home printer when I'm not home unless I really needed something printed. Regardless, this model printer says it doesn't support Google Cloud Print, but there are ways around it if you set it up on your Google account. Of course by doing that, you have to leave your PC on and always connected to the Internet.

Apple Airprint - Having 2 iPhones and an iPad in the house, printing from the Apple devices makes printing more accessible. Because this printer supports Airprint, it automatically shows up on your Apple devices as long as you set up the PIXMA printer on your local home network AND your Apple devices are on the same network.

[ COPYING / SCANNING ]
Scanning is pretty good. We scanned a couple photographs just to test and it seemed to be good quality. It's really easy.
Copying is a snap. You put the document on the scanner, close the lid, and then press to either copy in black or color. Not much easier than that.

[ IMPORTANT NEED-TO-KNOWS TO SAVE INK ]
Not sure if they were engineered this way (I've seen other Canon printers in the past do this), but by default, regardless of if you print in black only (say a report for school), black colors come from mixing your color cartidges together. So when you read reviews that this is an INK HOG, it's because those reviewers don't know how to set up the printer. Actually I blame this with Canon, because the average consumer would not realize this. To remove it, it's a hassle, but it's a major step if you want to save $$$ on ink. I will attempt to put the link directly here BUT, Amazon removes external links. The link is here: [...]
If this is the case, then just go to Canon's website. Look for the PIXMA printer and then go to Support. Type in "black" in the support search box and the document you want to look for is "Print using black ink only". Long story short, to turn it off, it's a combination of two settings:
1. Media Type must ALWAYS be Plain Paper. Otherwise you'll use up all your colors to make up black.
2. Grayscale Printing must be enabled.
That's it.

Lastly, I would suggest you not turn this printer off and NOT use the power save feature. When you do, it goes through the standard cycle of cleaning the heads and prepping the printer for print. EVERYTIME the printer does this, it wastes a little bit of ink. So you have to ask your self, do you want to save on electricity or do you want to save on ink (remember ink is about $45 - $50 a pack unless you want to buy them individually for $13 - $14 each). Of course there are 3rd party ink cartridges, but I haven't blown through my original set yet, so time will tell.Read more 87 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse C.
